verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead, and strengthened himself against Israel.
verses.web: Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his place, and strengthened himself against Israel.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat succeeded his father as king and strengthened his position against Israel.

verses.kjv: And he placed forces in all the fenced cities of Judah, and set garrisons in the land of Judah, and in the cities of Ephraim, which Asa his father had taken.
verses.web: He placed forces in all the fortified cities of Judah, and set garrisons in the land of Judah, and in the cities of Ephraim, which Asa his father had taken.
verses.ct: He stationed troops in every fortified city of Judah and placed garrisons throughout the land of Judah, as well as in the cities of Ephraim that his father Asa had captured.

verses.kjv: And the LORD was with Jehoshaphat, because he walked in the first ways of his father David, and sought not unto Baalim;
verses.web: LORD was with Jehoshaphat, because he walked in the first ways of his father David, and didn’t seek the Baals,
verses.ct: The LORD was with Jehoshaphat because he followed the example his ancestor David had set early on and didn't chase after the Baals.

verses.kjv: But sought to the Lord God of his father, and walked in his commandments, and not after the doings of Israel.
verses.web: but sought to the God of his father, and walked in his commandments, and not in the ways of Israel.
verses.ct: Instead, he sought the Lord God of his father and followed his commandments rather than imitating the practices of Israel.

verses.kjv: Therefore the LORD stablished the kingdom in his hand; and all Judah brought to Jehoshaphat presents; and he had riches and honour in abundance.
verses.web: Therefore LORD established the kingdom in his hand. All Judah brought tribute to Jehoshaphat, and he had riches and honor in abundance.
verses.ct: Because of this, the LORD established the kingdom firmly under his control. All of Judah brought gifts to Jehoshaphat, and he gained enormous wealth and honor.

verses.kjv: And his heart was lifted up in the ways of the LORD: moreover he took away the high places and groves out of Judah.
verses.web: His heart was lifted up in the ways of LORD. Furthermore, he took away the high places and the Asherah poles out of Judah.
verses.ct: He took great pride in following the ways of the LORD. He also removed the high places and the Asherah poles from Judah.

verses.kjv: Also in the third year of his reign he sent to his princes, even to Benhail, and to Obadiah, and to Zechariah, and to Nethaneel, and to Michaiah, to teach in the cities of Judah.
verses.web: Also in the third year of his reign he sent his princes, even Ben Hail, Obadiah, Zechariah, Nethanel, and Micaiah, to teach in the cities of Judah;
verses.ct: In the 3rd year of his reign, he sent out his officials — Benhail, Obadiah, Zechariah, Nethaneel, and Michaiah — to teach throughout the cities of Judah.

verses.kjv: And with them he sent Levites, even Shemaiah, and Nethaniah, and Zebadiah, and Asahel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehonathan, and Adonijah, and Tobijah, and Tobadonijah, Levites; and with them Elishama and Jehoram, priests.
verses.web: and with them the Levites, even Shemaiah, Nethaniah, Zebadiah, Asahel, Shemiramoth, Jehonathan, Adonijah, Tobijah, and Tobadonijah, the Levites; and with them Elishama and Jehoram, the priests.
verses.ct: With them he sent the Levites: Shemaiah, Nethaniah, Zebadiah, Asahel, Shemiramoth, Jehonathan, Adonijah, Tobijah, and Tobadonijah, along with the priests Elishama and Jehoram.

verses.kjv: And they taught in Judah, and had the book of the law of the LORD with them, and went about throughout all the cities of Judah, and taught the people.
verses.web: They taught in Judah, having the book of LORD’s law with them. They went about throughout all the cities of Judah and taught among the people.
verses.ct: They traveled to every city in Judah, carrying the book of the law of the LORD with them, and taught the people.

verses.kjv: And the fear of the LORD fell upon all the kingdoms of the lands that were round about Judah, so that they made no war against Jehoshaphat.
verses.web: The fear of LORD fell on all the kingdoms of the lands that were around Judah, so that they made no war against Jehoshaphat.
verses.ct: The fear of the LORD fell on all the kingdoms in the lands surrounding Judah, and none of them dared to make war against Jehoshaphat.

verses.kjv: Also some of the Philistines brought Jehoshaphat presents, and tribute silver; and the Arabians brought him flocks, seven thousand and seven hundred rams, and seven thousand and seven hundred he goats.
verses.web: Some of the Philistines brought Jehoshaphat presents and silver for tribute. The Arabians also brought him flocks, seven thousand seven hundred rams, and seven thousand seven hundred male goats.
verses.ct: Some of the Philistines brought Jehoshaphat gifts and silver as tribute. The Arabians also brought him flocks — 7,700 rams and 7,700 male goats.

verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat waxed great exceedingly; and he built in Judah castles, and cities of store.
verses.web: Jehoshaphat grew great exceedingly; and he built fortresses and store cities in Judah.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat grew increasingly powerful. He built fortresses and supply cities throughout Judah.

verses.kjv: And he had much business in the cities of Judah: and the men of war, mighty men of valour, were in Jerusalem.
verses.web: He had many works in the cities of Judah; and men of war, mighty men of valor, in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: He had extensive operations in the cities of Judah, and a force of mighty warriors stationed in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And these are the numbers of them according to the house of their fathers: Of Judah, the captains of thousands; Adnah the chief, and with him mighty men of valour three hundred thousand.
verses.web: This was the numbering of them according to their fathers’ houses: From Judah, the captains of thousands: Adnah the captain, and with him three hundred thousand mighty men of valor;
verses.ct: Here is the count of his forces, organized by their ancestral clans: From Judah, the commanders of thousands — Adnah was the chief commander, with 300,000 mighty warriors under him.

verses.kjv: And next to him was Jehohanan the captain, and with him two hundred and fourscore thousand.
verses.web: and next to him Jehohanan the captain, and with him two hundred eighty thousand;
verses.ct: Next was the commander Jehohanan, with 280,000 men under him.

verses.kjv: And next him was Amasiah the son of Zichri, who willingly offered himself unto the LORD; and with him two hundred thousand mighty men of valour.
verses.web: and next to him Amasiah the son of Zichri, who willingly offered himself to LORD, and with him two hundred thousand mighty men of valor.
verses.ct: Next was Amasiah son of Zichri, who had volunteered himself for the LORD's service, with 200,000 mighty warriors under him.

verses.kjv: And of Benjamin; Eliada a mighty man of valour, and with him armed men with bow and shield two hundred thousand.
verses.web: From Benjamin: Eliada, a mighty man of valor, and with him two hundred thousand armed with bow and shield;
verses.ct: From Benjamin: Eliada, a mighty warrior, with 200,000 men armed with bows and shields.

verses.kjv: And next him was Jehozabad, and with him an hundred and fourscore thousand ready prepared for the war.
verses.web: and next to him Jehozabad, and with him one hundred eighty thousand ready and prepared for war.
verses.ct: Next was Jehozabad, with 180,000 men trained and ready for battle.

verses.kjv: These waited on the king, beside those whom the king put in the fenced cities throughout all Judah.
verses.web: These were those who waited on the king, in addition to those whom the king put in the fortified cities throughout all Judah.
verses.ct: These were the forces that served the king directly, in addition to those he had stationed in the fortified cities throughout Judah.
